body_html:
Hi @rohitgirdhar @sounakdey ,

I got the same error, and there is a possible solution (I read it on a Chinese blog)... which I only test it on TX1:
Edit cublas_api.h ('/usr/local/cuda/targets/aarch64-linux/include/cublas_api.h' is the TX1 path) as follows

...
/*For different GEMM algorithm */
typedef enum{
 CUBLAS_GEMM_DFALT = -1,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO0 = 0,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO1 = 1,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO2 = 2,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO3 = 3,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO4 = 4,
 /* add these */ 
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO5         =  5,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO6         =  6,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO7         =  7,
/* add these */
} cublasGemmAlgo_t;
...

On TX1, it works.
body:
Hi @rohitgirdhar @sounakdey , 

I got the same error, and there is a possible solution (I read it on a Chinese blog)... which I only test it on TX1:
Edit cublas_api.h ('/usr/local/cuda/targets/aarch64-linux/include/cublas_api.h' is the TX1 path) as follows

```
...
/*For different GEMM algorithm */
typedef enum{
 CUBLAS_GEMM_DFALT = -1,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO0 = 0,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO1 = 1,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO2 = 2,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO3 = 3,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO4 = 4,
 /* add these */ 
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO5         =  5,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO6         =  6,
 CUBLAS_GEMM_ALGO7         =  7,
/* add these */
} cublasGemmAlgo_t;
...
```
On TX1, it works.
